Description: Base and lid of a polychrome painted cartonnage mummy-case for the mummy of a young boy, called Horemsah, anthropoid, wearing a short tunic, with a cloak wrapped around the waist and draped over the left shoulder from behind, the name, in black painted Demotic, appears below the left hand, with mythological group represented on the top of the head.
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 63 [33]. Mark Smith in Bierbrier (ed.) Portraits and Masks (1997) p.66 [pl.7.4]. Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, Japan 1999-2000, [121]. Riggs, Beautiful Burial in Roman Egypt (2005): 62, 65, 66, 71, 83, 85, 85 Fig. 33, 89, 93, 267; 247 n. 6 S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1076.
Published in S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1076.
Bibliographic references: Riggs 2005 / Beautiful burial in Roman Egypt (no.36, fig.33)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
